channel.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
channel.description:
The thread on SPUF was taken down, so here is the link to the one on Facepunch: [url='https://www.facepunch.com/threads/1140934']https://www.facepunch.com/threads/1140934[/url]
Pretty interesting.

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I wouldn’t argue against Valve either having an option for “vanilla” servers, or just a separate download that only connects to servers running original TF2 content.

I would support this.

Read full topic

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
It’s better than not playing TF2 at all. It may not be the optimal version, but if the in-game trade bugs someone enough not to play the PC version, they are then left with two choices. To not play a fundamentally great game by stopping altogether, or still experience it, albeit in a lesser form.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

or play the console versions.

Terrible suggestion, really.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: tonkat
item.description:
last time i played tf2 was a wile ago, i got into game and was like yay im having fun. then constantly, i mean the guy wouldnt fucking stop. trying to trade shit with me for some key thing i had. in the ned i just told him to fuck off cause i wanted to play the game.

but i see how you guys are complaining about mess. theres so much shit going on i dont even get it.

i just want to play the game and try get a kill. try.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Either that or play the console versions. All the core elements are there, without all the BS that has become a part of the game. I understand that I’m reiterating my point, but it needs to be said if someone is going to complain about the game in its current state.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
Then don’t play it.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: OrderOfDagon
item.description:
Team Fortress 2 just steals little things from other games, like the image above.

Seriously, what the fuck is that? Deus Ex in my Team Fortress 2?

Weapons that require long-time gaming just to attain. What happened to people who have lives to attend to? I can’t just sit there all day and do that item-trade shit.

And the fucking hates and cosmetic changes just add to the messy nonsense.

I get on server and see shit like this in chat;
Player1: Anyone wanna trade 2 flares for a refined?
Player2: SELLING CLOAK AND DAGGER FOR 1 CLASS TOKEN
Player3: how do i turn metal into refined…
etc,etc.

Not to mention all the 8 year olds playing as a result of the game being free. Which ultimately leads to hearing the bullshit above on the mic, too.

The game is a fucking sloppy mess and I hate it.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
I never said I wasn’t good at TF2. Maybe not great, but I can hold my own.

item.description:
If you want the game to be easier, go to a noob server. If you want the game to be cooler, wear epic clothes/hats.

item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Well that’s bogus. And people take this stuff seriously? I can maybe understand why people might take the powerful weapons seriously, but I don’t see the point of cosmetic upgrades unless they boosted stats, or something of that nature.

I’d totally wear that pink beanie that I won for beating Portal 2 if it only boosted my stats.

Read full topic

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: FERGUS
item.description:
MysticJ:

It’s funny. I’m used to the standard, that if I google something, like “Genuine Purity Fists” (???), I should, among the first few entries at least, see something like “Wikipedia definition of …” or “Introduction to …”

Not in this case. I’m having trouble making heads or tails of this. What the fuck is Genuine Purity Fists?

https://wiki.teamfortress.com/wiki/Purity_Fist

500×554 284 KB

Read full topic

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Admittedly, it’s broken either way, but the PS3 version is worse off than the 360 one. I haven’t had too many problems with it on the 360, but then again, I don’t play demo for any extended period of time. I’ve since moved onto the PC version, but usually I used either the soldier or engineer classes.

Unless you use it to your advantage and kill people through walls :fffuuu:

item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco

item.title: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Yeah, the hats and new weapons have forced me to uninstall the game – permanently.

I just can’t get into all that laggy and screen-cluttering item-nonsense.

The game, Team Fortress 2, is officially dead. Giving birth to the proceeds of a new game; Item Hat-mess 2.

I know it’s a sin to say this here, but honestly, if you really want the core gameplay of TF2, you’d be better off just going to the console ports of The Orange Box. People still play it, and it hasn’t been updated with the current tweaks.

Thing is, you’re also stuck with original five maps.

Read full topic
item.source: A possible reason for the Steam fiasco
